intro: Vernonia chthonocephala, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and striking member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its unique, spiky, violet-colored bracts that resemble the shape of a ghost, giving it its common name. The plant is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
